vrpnserver

Class VrpnServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • vrpnserver.VrpnServer

  • public class VrpnServer
extends java.lang.Object
    The remote activity for the Android VRPN controller. This class is not very pretty, but is the glue which holds the server together.
    Author:
    UNC VRPN Team

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int IDLE_INTERVAL
      The interval (in milliseconds) between calls to vrpn's mainloop() functions.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      VrpnServer()
      Creates a VrpnServer instance hosting two vrpn Buttons.
      VrpnServer(int port)
      Creates a VrpnServer instance hosting two vrpn Buttons at the specified port.
      VrpnServer(int port, int buttonCount)
      Creates a VrpnServer instance hosting the specified number of vrpn Buttons at the specified port.
      VrpnServer(int port, int buttonCount, JniBuilder.Analog... analogs) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void sendIdle()
      Calls the vrpn connection's mainLoop to send an empty message to persist the connection.
      void setupVrpn()
      Creates/recreates the JniLayer and attaches the phone's sensors.
      void stop() 
      void updateAnalogVal(int analogId, int channel, float val)
      Sets the value for the specified channel in the specified analog server.
      void updateButton(int id, boolean val)
      Sets the status (up or down) of a given button.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • IDLE_INTERVAL

        public static final int IDLE_INTERVAL
        The interval (in milliseconds) between calls to vrpn's mainloop() functions. Calling these on a timer prevents the client application from complaining that it hasn't heard from the Android server.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • VrpnServer

        public VrpnServer(int port,
          int buttonCount,
          JniBuilder.Analog... analogs)

      • VrpnServer

        public VrpnServer(int port,
          int buttonCount)
        Creates a VrpnServer instance hosting the specified number of vrpn Buttons at the specified port. All buttons are available at: "Button0@localhost"

      • VrpnServer

        public VrpnServer(int port)
        Creates a VrpnServer instance hosting two vrpn Buttons at the specified port. "Button0@localhost"

      • VrpnServer

        public VrpnServer()
        Creates a VrpnServer instance hosting two vrpn Buttons. "Button0@localhost:10000"

    • Method Detail

      • updateButton

        public void updateButton(int id,
                boolean val)
        Sets the status (up or down) of a given button. True for button down, false for button up.
        Parameters:
        buttonId - - the button whose status to update
        state - - whether to set the button's status to pressed (true) or not pressed (false)

      • updateAnalogVal

        public void updateAnalogVal(int analogId,
                   int channel,
                   float val)
        Sets the value for the specified channel in the specified analog server.
        Parameters:
        analogId - - The identifier of the analog server to update
        channel - - Which channel (or dimension) of the analog to pass the value
        val - - The new value

      • setupVrpn

        public void setupVrpn()
        Creates/recreates the JniLayer and attaches the phone's sensors. The content of this method was moved from onResume()

      • sendIdle

        public void sendIdle()
        Calls the vrpn connection's mainLoop to send an empty message to persist the connection.

      • stop

        public void stop()
